description.narrative: The Responsibility to Protect Regional Partnership will support implementation of the Responsibility to Protect (R2P) in the Asia Pacific and strengthen Australia's leading role on atrocity prevention in the region. It will support activities to help build partnerships and communities of practice committed to implementing the R2P principle in the region. This investment will provide support to the Asia Pacific Centre for the Responsibility to Protect to advance the R2P principle by stimulating knowledge and understanding, deepening consensus and supporting states to build their capacity to protect populations from mass atrocity crimes. The total value of this investment is $1.8 million over 3 years, starting 2017-18.
